questions.text: Who is not in favor of the plea in the beginning of the episode?
questions.explanation:
George Sr.

	Barry Zuckerkorn ends up getting the family a plea so that George Sr. doesn't need to go to trial.  Barry says that it may be a good idea to take it because no better offers will probably come along, but he never read the details of it, so Michael decides to read through it to make sure that everything is a smart idea.  Meanwhile, George Sr. doesn't want to leave prison because his admirer, Cindi Lightballoon, recently gave away the fact that she was a government mole in order to prove that she loves him, and she says that they can beat the case.

questions.text: After meeting with the family, where does Michael read the plea?
questions.explanation:
At a bar.

	Gob accompanies Michael at the bar and tells him that he needs to relax more and go on a date.  Michael eventually meets Maggie Lizer, played by Julia Louis-Dreyfus.  Maggie is blind, but Michael doesn't realize it for quite a while.

questions.text: What grade is Maeby in during this episode?
questions.explanation:
Nine.

	Lindsay and Tobias are nervous because Maeby is nearly failing the ninth grade.  They decide to use a more hands-on approach and ask George Michael to tutor Maeby.  They say that despite the shortage in cash that they've recently been having, they'll find a way to repay him.

questions.text: How much money does Maeby give to George Michael for doing her homework?
questions.explanation:
$120.

	Maeby says that if George Michael fills in the answers to her failed test, she'll see where she went wrong, and she gives him some money for the job.  She says that she's giving him $200 but she doesn't know that six twenty dollar bills doesn't equal $200.

questions.text: What is the name of Maggie's dog?
questions.explanation:
Justice.

	After having his first one-night stand with Maggie, Michael attempts to break it off, but he realizes for the first time that she's blind.  He decides to date her again because he feels that it's the right thing to do.

questions.text: Gob gets married in this episode.
questions.explanation:
True.

	After telling Michael to go on a one-night stand the previous night, Gob also went out with a woman.  Both of them decided to be daring and went through a series of crazy things until they reached a climax and got married.  They never ended up consummating the marriage because his new wife had to get to work.

questions.text: Did George Sr. say that 'faith was a fact' on his "Caged Wisdom" video?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	Although he said that, it was used in his blooper reel at the end of the movie.  Cindi Lightballoon thinks that George Sr. will win the trial because of his faith in his religion, but George Sr. is angry with her because he expected her to have evidence.

questions.text: Why does Lucille want to divorce George Sr. for a brief period of time?
questions.correct: She caught him touching Cindi at the prison
options: She was sick of being alone
She didn't like his newfound religion
questions.explanation:
She caught him touching Cindi at the prison.

	Lucille catches George Sr. playing with Cindi Lightballoon through the fence of the jail, but after Cindi tells George Sr. that his faith will free him, he fesses up and says that she was a government informant.  Lucille understands that he was just trying to get information and she forgives him.

questions.text: Who is the attorney that the Bluths are opposing in court?
questions.explanation:
Maggie.

	In court, Michael realizes that he's made a huge mistake and he leaves he courtroom to prevent her from finding him.  Meanwhile, Barry ends up stalling the trial in order for everyone to figure out what to do.  Gob and Barry tell Michael that he's in the perfect position to find out what evidence they have against George Sr.

questions.text: What is the name that Maeby uses when people are fundraising for her?
questions.explanation:
Surely.

	George Michael discovers that Maeby has been earning all of her money by pretending to be a dying girl in a wheelchair and having people raise money for her.  Meanwhile, Michael decides to go to Maggie's house to set things straight, and she asks him for his help by giving him an overview of everything in the case against the Bluth family.
